title.justification: The title clearly indicates the key focus of the research paper.

extractions.description: This paper proposes an autoregressive framework for modeling dynamic networks with dependent edges. By assuming the edges of a network at each time point are independent conditionally on their lagged values, the model facilitates both simulation and maximum likelihood estimation. It also introduces an improved estimator that addresses slow convergence rates of the initial MLEs due to a large number of parameters.

type.justification: The paper primarily discusses the development of a new theoretical framework and estimation methods for dynamic networks with dependent edges, rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: We propose an autoregressive framework for modelling dynamic networks with dependent edges...

name.justification: The paper focuses on developing a framework for modeling networks, specifically dynamic networks with autoregressive properties.
name.quote: We propose an autoregressive framework for modelling dynamic networks with dependent edges.

name.justification: The paper discusses temporal dependencies in network models and how to handle them.
name.quote: An AR(m) network process defined above is a Markov chain with order m.

name.justification: The model is introduced in the paper as the primary methodology for modeling dynamic networks with dependent edges.
name.quote: We propose an autoregressive framework for modelling dynamic networks with dependent edges.

is_contributed.justification: The Autoregressive Network Model is introduced and developed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose a new autoregressive based Markov chain model with dependent edge.

is_executed.justification: The models are executed as part of the simulations and real-world illustrations provided in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Section 5 presents an illustration via simulation for the proposed transitivity model. Further illustration with a real dynamic network data set is reported in Section 6.

is_compared.justification: The model is compared with other existing models, including various forms of temporal ERGMs and related methods.
is_compared.quote: In the following analysis, we fit the model separately to the first 13 and last 26 snapshots, referred to as 'period 1' and 'period 2'.

referenced_paper_title.value: Jiang, B., Li, J. and Yao, Q. (2023b). Autoregressive networks, Journal of Machine Learning Research 24(227): 1–69.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper provides foundational details and precedents for the autoregressive network models discussed and extended in the current paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Jiang, B., Li, J. and Yao, Q. (2023b). Autoregressive networks, Journal of Machine Learning Research 24(227): 1–69.

name.justification: This dataset is used in the paper to illustrate the application of the proposed model.
name.quote: We apply the transitivity model introduced in Section 3.3 to a dynamic network dataset of email interactions in a medium-sized Polish manufacturing company, from January to September 2010 (Michalski et al., 2014).

referenced_paper_title.value: Michalski, R., Kajdanowicz, T., Bródka, P. and Kazienko, P. (2014). Seed selection for spread of influence in social networks: Temporal vs. static approach, New Generation Computing 32(3-4): 213–235.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference provides details of the email interactions dataset used in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Michalski, R., Kajdanowicz, T., Bródka, P. and Kazienko, P. (2014). Seed selection for spread of influence in social networks: Temporal vs. static approach, New Generation Computing 32(3-4): 213–235.

name.justification: This dataset is used in the paper to validate the model with additional real-world examples.
name.quote: We apply our model to an additional dynamic network dataset, in this case of face-to-face interactions among attendees of an academic conference. The conference in question was the 2009 congress of the Société Française d’Hygiène Hospitalière (SFHH) (Cattuto et al., 2010; Génois and Barrat, 2018).

referenced_paper_title.value: Cattuto, C., Van den Broeck, W., Barrat, A., Colizza, V., Pinton, J.-F. and Vespignani, A. (2010). Dynamics of person-to-person interactions from distributed RFID sensor networks, PloS one 5(7): e11596.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference provides the details of the SFHH conference dataset used in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Cattuto, C., Van den Broeck, W., Barrat, A., Colizza, V., Pinton, J.-F. and Vespignani, A. (2010). Dynamics of person-to-person interactions from distributed RFID sensor networks, PloS one 5(7): e11596.

name.justification: R is used for the development of the implementation code for the autoregressive network models in the paper.
name.quote: The simulations in this section utilise our development R package arnetworks, which provides a user-friendly implementation of the practical estimation algorithm described above.

referenced_paper_title.value: R Core Team (2023). R: A language and environment for statistical computing, R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria. URL https://www.R-project.org/.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is provided to acknowledge the use of R in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: R Core Team (2023). R: A language and environment for statistical computing, R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria. URL https://www.R-project.org/.

name.justification: The arnetworks package is specifically developed for implementing the autoregressive network models proposed in the paper.
name.quote: The simulations in this section utilise our development R package arnetworks, which provides a user-friendly implementation of the practical estimation algorithm described above.

referenced_paper_title.value: Chang, J., MacDonald, P. W. (2023). arnetworks: An R package for autoregressive network models.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference paper provides the foundational details of the arnetworks package used in the simulations of the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Chang, J., MacDonald, P. W. (2023). arnetworks: An R package for autoregressive network models.
